intro: [WRONG START] Lathyrus clymenes var. articulatus, commonly known as the purple waxy pea, is a perennial legume native to Europe and western Asia. It features slender, climbing stems with trifoliate leaves composed of three oval, hairy leaflets. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of purple or pink, typically in early summer. Its fruit is a pod containing several small, dark seeds. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
